change.item: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::James Harold Shoemaker Papers)//EN" "reg_008.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

titlepage.titleproper: Register of the James Harold Shoemaker Papers, 1924-1983
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1997 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, orders, manuals, printed matter, and photographs, relating to economic warfare during World War II, the bombing of Japan, American military government in Japan and Korea, and the economy of Hawaii.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], James Harold Shoemaker Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1984.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

controlaccess.head: Access Points
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Board of Economic Warfare.
controlaccess.subject: Military government.
World War, 1939-1945.
World War, 1939-1945--Aerial operations.
World War, 1939-1945--Economic aspects.
World War, 1939-1945--Japan.

chronitem.event: Born, Dubuque, Iowa
B.A., State College, Iowa
Faculty member, Nagasaki College, Japan
M.A., University of Iowa, Iowa
Instructor, Department of Economics, Brown University, Rhode Island
Faculty member, Harvard University, Massachusetts
Professor of Economics, Brown University
Research Analyst, Bureau of Labor Statistics, United States Department of Labor (summer months)
Author, Labor in the Territory of Hawaii, 1939
Director of Economic Survey of Hawaii, Bureau of Labor Statistics, sponsored by the United States Congress
Consultant, Office of Export Control, United States Government
Deputy Director, Far Eastern Division, United States Government
Director, Enemy Potential Division, Office of Economic Warfare, United States Government
Lieutenant Colonel, War Department, Military Government Division, United States Government
Colonel, United States Strategic Bombing Survey, Japan
Dean, Business School, University of Hawaii
Major General (assimilated rank), United States Navy mission in Japan
Chairman, National Economic Board, United States Military Government in South Korea
Chairman, Economic Department, University of Hawaii
Author, The Economy of Hawaii in 1947
Director, Program Coordinator Division, National Security Resources Board, Executive Office of the President of the United States
Vice President and Director of Business Research, Bank of Hawaii
Consultant, National Security Resources Board (summer months)
Member, United States Civil Service Commission
Member, Reserve Bank of New Zealand Mission
President, Pacific and Asian Affairs Council
Trustee, Bernice P. Bishop Museum, Hawaii
Member, Trade missions to Peru and Equador, Trade Development Bureau, United States Department of Commerce
Honorary LL.D degree, University of Hawaii
President, University of Hawaii Foundation
Member, Trade missions to Guyana, Surinam and Netherlands Antilles, Trade Development Bureau, United States Department of Commerce
Director, surveys for airlines serving Hawaii
Consultant and Coordinator for Rehabilitation, Government of Alaska
Vice President, University of Alaska
Consultant on economy of Alaska, Government of Alaska
Author, Growth Potential of the Interiors of Alaska
Died, Pine Bluff, Arkansas

scopecontent.p: Announcements, certificates, clippings, fraternity membership card, memoranda, notes, obituary and press releases, arranged alphabetically by physical form
Letters arranged alphabetically by correspondent. Includes a few letters neither from nor to James Shoemaker
Articles, conference papers, congressional testimony, notes, outlines, speeches, and related correspondence and press releases arranged chronologically by title

Charts, correspondence, handbooks, language guides, maps, memoranda, military dictionary, notes, pamphlets, printed matter, and reports relating to James Shoemaker's service in the army during the Second World War, arranged chronologically by the names of the departments and then by physical form. Also includes the records relating to his participation in the post-war years in the United States navy missions, military government in Korea, and the National Security Resources Board under Presidents Harry Truman and Dwight Eisenhower

Clippings, newsletters, notes, printed matter, press releases, reports, and statements, relating to Hawaii and to James Shoemaker's position as vice-president at the Bank of Hawaii, and to the 100th anniversary celebration of diplomatic relations between Japan and the United States, arranged alphabetically by physical form. Includes correspondence with the president of the Bank of Hawaii
Brochures, correspondence, memoranda, newsletters, press releases, printed matter, programs, reports, statements, arranged alphabetically by subject
Certificate for the degree of Master of Arts from the University of Iowa, 1924
5 prints depicting James Shoemaker with other unidentified individuals
